docblock.description: helper method for setting up vfsStream in unit tests
docblock.long-description:
Instead of vfsStreamWrapper::register(); vfsStreamWrapper::setRoot(vfsStream::newDirectory('root')); you can simply do vfsStream::setup() which yields the same result. Additionally, the method returns the freshly created root directory which you can use to make further adjustments to it.

Assumed $structure contains an array like this:

array('Core' = array('AbstractFactory' => array('test.php'    => 'some text content',
                                                'other.php'   => 'Some more text content',
                                                'Invalid.csv' => 'Something else',
                                          ),
                     'AnEmptyFolder'   => array(),
                     'badlocation.php' => 'some bad content',
               )
)

the resulting directory tree will look like this: root - Core |- badlocation.php |- AbstractFactory | |- test.php | |- other.php | - Invalid.csv - AnEmptyFolder Arrays will become directories with their key as directory name, and strings becomes files with their key as file name and their value as file content.

tag.name: param
tag.description: optional name of root directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: optional file permissions of root directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: optional directory structure to add under root directory

docblock.description: creates vfsStream directory structure from an array and adds it to given base dir
docblock.long-description:
Assumed $structure contains an array like this:

array('Core' = array('AbstractFactory' => array('test.php'    => 'some text content',
                                                'other.php'   => 'Some more text content',
                                                'Invalid.csv' => 'Something else',
                                          ),
                     'AnEmptyFolder'   => array(),
                     'badlocation.php' => 'some bad content',
               )
)

the resulting directory tree will look like this: baseDir - Core |- badlocation.php |- AbstractFactory | |- test.php | |- other.php | - Invalid.csv - AnEmptyFolder Arrays will become directories with their key as directory name, and strings becomes files with their key as file name and their value as file content.

If no baseDir is given it will try to add the structure to the existing root directory without replacing existing childs except those with equal names.

tag.name: param
tag.description: directory structure to add under root directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: base directory to add structure to optional

docblock.description: helper method to create subdirectories recursively

tag.name: param
tag.description: subdirectory structure to add

tag.name: param
tag.description: directory to add the structure to optional

docblock.description: copies the file system structure from given path into the base dir
docblock.long-description: If no baseDir is given it will try to add the structure to the existing root directory without replacing existing childs except those with equal names. File permissions are copied as well. Please note that file contents will only be copied if their file size does not exceed the given $maxFileSize which is 1024 KB.

tag.name: param
tag.description: path to copy the structure from

tag.name: param
tag.description: directory to add the structure to optional

tag.name: param
tag.description: maximum file size of files to copy content from optional

docblock.description: returns a new file with given name
returns a new directory with given name
docblock.long-description: If the name contains slashes, a new directory structure will be created. The returned directory will always be the parent directory of this directory structure.
If the system does not support posix_getuid() the current user will be root (0).
If the system does not support posix_getgid() the current group will be root (0).

docblock.description: use visitor to inspect a content structure
docblock.long-description:
If the given content is null it will fall back to use the current root directory of the stream wrapper.
